slides.description: Nainital: Crisp mountain air, the shimmering emerald lake mirroring the clouds, and the happy echo of laughter bouncing off the hills. Remember the boat ride, the creak of the oars, and the taste of steaming momos devoured with numb fingers? Nainital. A swirl of vibrant colors and shared stories, etched forever in our hearts.

Breach Day – the air crackling with anticipation, a nervous energy that tasted like static on the tongue. The airlock hissed open, a sudden, blinding rush of freedom and the scent of ozone after months of recycled air. It was more than just stepping outside; it was breathing life again, feeling the sun, however filtered, warm on our faces. I remember the clumsy scramble for position, everyone eager to be first, yet hesitant to break the unspoken line. And then, the gasp – the collective inhale of a world reborn, a world we'd fought so hard to reclaim.
